website_summaries.verdict: A suitable wheelbarrow. Other models we tested come at lower prices and offer equal or better quality.
pros: Provides smooth operation and a rugged but practical design
Steel construction holds up even with tough jobs and is quite durable over time
cons: Its high price tag puts it out of range for budget-conscious consumers
Front tray brace often gets in the way when dumping loads

customer_reviews.title: JUNK TIRES
customer_reviews.text: IT IS LIGHT BUT HOLDS A LOT. THE TIRES ARE PURE JUNK HAD TO FILL WITH GUNK TO KEEP THE TIRES INFLATED AND FOR THE PRICE YOU WOULD THINK THEY WOULD PUT ON BETTER TIRES? TIRE BLEW UP EVEN WITH GUNK IN THEM. I NOTICED AFTER ONLY 3 MONTHS USE THE TIRES WERE WEATHER CRACKED I NEED TO FIND SOLID REPLACEMENT TIRES SOMEWHERE?
customer_reviews.author: john c dodds

customer_reviews.title: cheap construction and NOT heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and disappointing construction. The handle comes in pieces that you fit together and as anyone knows....that's a recipe for a cheap product. And the weight it says it can carry, nope. Don't even try. I put some rocks in and the actual container well bent! So disappointed. Floppy handle. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HLR

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars given but I made that cart work for that s***
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Final assembled product feel is very solid Pretty nice sized heavy duty polyethylene tub Amazing balance and control even with a decent heavy sized load Solid tires Cons: The manual is ridiculously useless. Because most of the parts werent labeled. Nor were most the bags. I had to look at the pic and then just guess with the big bolts til I figured out what goes where. So for that, Im def deducting a star, all because you guys wanted to skimp on sticker labels? Ill move on.. And im done.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this trailer is very good; however
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this trailer is very good; however, it should have been publicized that it takes at least two people to assemble it. The instructions were only drawings, which it made it more difficult to put together given they sent the wrong size screws for part of the assembly. They were supposed to be 1-3/4" and they were 1". Since I had lined up someone to help me, we made do so I could get it put together and my help wouldn't have to come back. Bottom line: I'd give it a "5" on quality and a "1" or "2" on instructions, parts, etc.
customer_reviews.author: mooncrow

customer_reviews.title: Watch for missing parts...
customer_reviews.text: This item was received with no tools, and missing screws / bolts. After contacting the manufacturer, I received the missing parts after 10 days. Even with the new parts, I had to use some of the first parts to accommodate the missing parts from the second shipment. This was a pain in the A*S to assemble - basically needs two people. In hindsight, I wish I had bought a used wheelbarrow from Craigslist for much less cost and frustration. Not recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Both Tires went flat already. More flats on a second cart. Dry rot or faulty.
customer_reviews.text: One of the tubs had a hole in from the start, so I ordered some tubes. Well the other tire went flat. The tube had a blowout internally probably because of the way the tube was installed at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: billyc33

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: I may change my review if I can ever get this assembled and see how it works, but so far I have not been able to. My daughter & I have spent hours working on it and we cannot get parts to tighten or the handle end to go on evenly. The directions are not clear & do not specify what tools you need leading to a lot of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Aronson

customer_reviews.title: Problem tires
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a more stable wheelbarrow, but before even using it one time, the inner tube split. Found a replacement to order, but I now wonder how often we will need to replace these Update: contacted customer service, and a new tire is being sent I was told that the psi recommendation is wrong on some of these carts. It says 42, but should be 22
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very solid and dependable wheel borrow.
customer_reviews.text: I have been hauling bricks and cinder blocks. It handles them with ease. I generally pull it with a heavy load instead of pushing it, as it moves a lot easier, especially over sticks and debris. I definitionally like this better than a 1 wheel model. When I first unpacked it, I thought it would be too light for heavy hauling, despite the heavy rating, but it works fine. I have not complaints.
customer_reviews.author: jake2000

customer_reviews.title: Substandard Wheels
customer_reviews.text: While the cart itself seems well built, the two tires and wheels are poor quality. I pumped the tires up to the manufacturer's recommended PSI. When I went to use the cart a few days later, but tires were flat and had blown partly off the wheels. I subsequently tried to refill the tubes, but it appears that they had blown apart and would not hold air. I have since ordered two new tires and wheels from a different source.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: A very good wheelbarrow to use. Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: I started using this out of the gate the day I got it. It is GREAT! Love it and Amazon is cheaper than Lowe's :) Building it wasn't easy, but I managed by myself in about an hour. Overall it is very sturdy and is comfortable to handle and the day of getting it, I gave this a workout hauling bags of fertilizer, topsoil, sand and several loads of pea gravel. I don't understand the complainers about the building issue. It's like putting together any wheelbarrow. Though, I will admit, the instructions could have been a little better.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Delivered to me today, very timely. Wet easy assembly. Put it together myself in about 30 minutes, easy to follow instructions and I'm no geniius. Pretty decent wheelbarrow, not comparable to a traditional wheelbarrow because of the handles but it's decent. We'll see how it holds up, feels pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best wheel barrel I have ever owned, and I've gone through a few!
customer_reviews.text: I live and work on a farm. Single wheel barrels tip too easily and require one to carry too much of the weight. Wheel barrels with the tipping tongue protruding out front get caught up on uneven ground. Wheel barrels with skinny wheels sink too far into the mud. Metal barrels bend out of shape. This wheel barrel does none of that. I can load a couple hundred pound of feed in it, and easily push it through thick mud into the barn. (I am a 58 year old woman.) When tipping out a load of muck, the barrel pivots on the wheel axis. I love this barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Experienced builders only. Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: The metal pieces were bent wrong and misaligned. The inside wheel bearing dust comer was damaged and I had to remove the bearing to rebuild it. Definitely not a product for the inexperienced builder
customer_reviews.author: Joe St. John III

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD CHOICE TO REPLACE A 2-WHEEL WHEELBARROW.
customer_reviews.text: I FOUND THAT THIS CART WAS EASY TO MANEUVER, HOWEVER MY USE IS FOR CLEANING HORSE STALLS. THE CART DOESN'T EMPTY WELL. IT LITERALLY HAS TO BE FLIPPED OVER TO REMOVE ALL OF THE CONTENTS. AFTER FLIPPING IT OVER IT STILL REQUIRES SOME ADDITIONAL SHAKING TO REMOVE THE BEDDING IN IT'S ENTIRETY. I MADE THE WRONG CHOICE BUYING THIS OVERPRICED CART.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Requires Two People or One with Long, Strong Arms
customer_reviews.text: It should be simple, and in fact is a simple design, yet It took me three hours, a few cuss words, some "calm down" time, and some weird contortions..... It says not to "tighten the screws until all parts are assembled, but they mean "just barely put it together until all parts are assembled". You must not tighten past a half turn or so, because the fit is so tight. You need two people because the barrow is so deep and wide.... However, once it is assembled and you tighten it up, its a nice piece of equipment. The wheels are smooth over any terrain. and it's really easy to maneuver....
customer_reviews.author: Michael Caveney

customer_reviews.title: this arrived monday even though amazon said it didnt
customer_reviews.text: they say its running late but it already arrived...a bit of a chore to get it together but great once its done...Tire blew out the second time we used it...sigh
customer_reviews.author: barbiehunter

customer_reviews.title: I will re-review after I've used it, so this ...
customer_reviews.text: I will re-review after I've used it, so this review is just a comment on the instructions, or should I say, lack of. There are no written instructions, simply a parts list and confusing drawings, and the Chinese word for bolt must be the same as for screw, because they list three sets of screws and one set of bolts. I always thought a screw is something you screw into an object, and a bolt is something you attach objects together with a bolt and nut. So ignore the parts list in that respect, there are no screws used in this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wait

customer_reviews.title: Works and assembles as stated you just need to follow directions.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. And it didn't take fifteen minutes to assemble as long as you follow directions and don't tighten anything until you're done assembling everything. Some might prefer the dump style cart but for the money.....you can't go wrong with this thing. We hauled four yards of river Rock into the backyard with it and tote fire wood to the pile etc. I would suggest you keep it under three hundred pounds unless you really need that workout but it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little leary about this cart. It arrived in good condition on time as always with Amazon. I am seventy two years old and it was very easy to assemble. It took me about forty minutes by myself to assemble this product. Its very well made with all the machine bolts the right length. The diagrams are self explanatory and easy to follow.I would highly recommend this cart with my only wish list being it had been eight cubic feet instead of seven.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Rone

customer_reviews.title: Strong and light cart!  I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Hey, this thing is much easier to handle than a regular old wheelbarrow. Went together fairly easy. Directions could’ve been a bit more clear but no biggie. I use mine to haul “gumbo soil” around my yard while digging an area for a new driveway and thought I’d give this new styled yard cart a shot and I love it. It can take some abuse and has held up well as I’m not light on the tools I use.
customer_reviews.author: Todd C-Dray

customer_reviews.title: Assembly issues
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled Polar Trailer and it appears to be just what I needed. Word of caution on the assembly though, do not tighten any hardware on the handle assembly until you have fingered-tightened only all of them. Had to make several attempts at installing the arms until I figured this out. Once that's done, no problem. Feels like a solid piece of equipment. Ready to start hauling stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Roznovsky

customer_reviews.title: Steady and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I bought. I've used mine for 3 years for firewood in the winter and for gardening in the summer. It's very sturdy, and having 2 wheels makes it so much more steady than our old wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Dyer Henchey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this product I was really excited and have been very pleased with how well it's worked - it's relatively light, large tub, and was seemingly sturdy. However, the other day I noticed a crack in the tub. I have not put anything near the tub load capacity in there or anything else that would cause this crack. I am very disappointed and have submitted a warranty claim. Here's hoping the company actually respects their 5 year warranty...
customer_reviews.author: Diane Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Don't Believe "Easy Assembly"
customer_reviews.text: The Polar Trailer seems like a nice utility trailer for the yard but putting it together was a challenge by far. Everything went smooth until we got to the Bottom Handles. The holes did not line up exactly. I had to solicit help to manhandle the thing until they could slip the washer and nut on for tightening. Just for the two bottom handles it took almost a half hour to get them on. At one point I thought about packing it up and sending it back. Again, I think it will be a nice trailer for the yard, but don’t believe the writing on the side of the box that says, “Easy Assembly”.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I do not like how it handles the heat. The sides become soft and the structure becomes wobbly. The rims have warped in the heat and pops the tire off everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Tub looks to be of good quality and wheels look ok but time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Phillips head bolts had to be cut because the cuts were never finished ,Bolts were stripped and some were too short .Instructions were just pictures with no explanation Holes didn`t line up .Tub looks to be of good quality and wheels look ok but time will tell. Only thing easy to assembly was removing the "Easy to Assembly" decal .
customer_reviews.author: William Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Much superior to a wheel barrow and we are very satisfied.,
customer_reviews.text: We use this cart for moving straw, leaves, and fallen limbs in our yard. We gave it five stars on everything except assembly. We kept looking for "two flat plastic washers." The metal washers were obvious, but the flat plastic washers were a problem. They look like a piece of black hose about 1/2 inches high. This cart is much superior to a wheel barrow and we are very pleased with the way it functions.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: I love this wheelbarrow and would buy it again in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Seriously worth every penny. I love this wheelbarrow and would buy it again in a heartbeat. It's easy to assemble and even easier to use. It is pretty wide, but you make it work with whatever your storage situation is because it's so nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great haul
customer_reviews.text: We haul wood into our bsement snd had gone through 2 previous wheelbarrows due to the harsh treatment and weight they had to haul. This one is definitely more durable and easier to handle despite the weight put on it.
customer_reviews.author: gloria figg

customer_reviews.title: Absolute workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a large two-level terraced garden with the Nicolock Alta Wall Pro retaining wall system. Between the retaining wall blocks, aggregate, fill dirt, and topsoil, I moved approximately 80,000 lbs of material over 2 months, all using this cart. MUCH easier to move than a wheelbarrow. Love how the center of gravity is low. Took a huge beating this summer - is extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Thiele

customer_reviews.title: well made, looks like it will last
customer_reviews.text: You really need a screw gun and 2 people to put this together. I have owned 2 wheel barrels in the last 20 years and they both had wood frames that did not last. This looks like it will last a long time even if I keep it outside. I am pleased with it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J.

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's horrible hard to push thru 1in snow heavy tires are ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's horrible hard to push thru 1in snow heavy tires are to big barrel to many different sizes all aroud can't stack anything in it very dissapointed in the whole thing, waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This wheelbarrow exceeded my expectation. Rugged and durable, very easy to maneuver heavy loads with two front wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best investment. This trailer is well built and very ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best investment. This trailer is well built and very easy to move about. Forget the days of balancing a wheelbarrow. This is stable and moves up to 400 lbs. Highly recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Richlin

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to assemble and one part as significantly bent. Tire blew after one week. Obviously not worth taking apart and sending back so chalked it up to live and learn experience and bought a new wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: john erwin

customer_reviews.title: Assembly not easy due to alignment difficulties
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled the unit appears to be very easy to maneuver and use. However the assembly was difficult as the hole alignment was such that I needed help to attached the bolts. I followed the instructions leaving bolts loose but even that was not sufficient. This should not be that difficult. Poor manufacturing. Hopefully that issue Is behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne M

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Garden Tool....a MUST have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heavy duty cart and it is easy to handle. Great construction and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Himes

customer_reviews.title: Very good quantity cart and so easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a “bear” to assemble need two people. Gift for my husband and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality control but Love the cart
customer_reviews.text: Amazon delivered it a day early - very cool. But there was no assembly manual, and since I am a DIYr I assembled it and then got the manual on line to check my work. Besides no manual, they shorted me 2 washers and included 4 extra bolt and 2 nuts - what is going on here? BUT it is very well built, and is VERY sturdy, so I recommend it with 5 stars except for the poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Denney

customer_reviews.title: Great wheel barrow/ manure mover!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one we bought so we can have one in each barn. Used daily for manure. First one is a few years old and going strong. A few months in we did get a slow flat and Polar sent us a whole new wheel pronto. Customer service is great and easy to deal with in USA.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: would have assembled faster with extra hands.
customer_reviews.text: a bit of a game to assemble alone but took my time and it did go together.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hector

customer_reviews.title: easy to handle!
customer_reviews.text: Large and very sturdy, I have always had the one wheel type but now i'm older {80} and need the stability to operate it. THIS FITS THE BILL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: so glad I got the Polar Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I debated whether to get a 2 wheel wheelbarrow or the Polar Trailer...so glad I got the Polar Trailer...works great and good capacity. So far I used for moving firewood, bags of cement and mulch. well-balanced and easy to push & pull. I wrapped the handle with non-slip hockey stick tape and makes it easier to grip.
customer_reviews.author: jamison

customer_reviews.title: Frustration
customer_reviews.text: Warning. This cart comes unassembled BUT the screws they sent didn't fit any of the bolts. I returned it. I went to a big box home center and bought an assembled one for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Noname

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble with a helper to steady the cart. works great. pull or push
customer_reviews.author: Online since68

customer_reviews.title: Popped tore out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This product came with a flat tire that will not pump up. What a pain. Do yourself a favor and go with a product that has tires that won't go flat right out of the box. Also, it was hard to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: JONETTE JENKINS

customer_reviews.title: Front too unstable.
customer_reviews.text: If too much weight is out in front it dumps over way too easy. Design issue. Otherwise fine.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Screws strip easily. Instructions not very good
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to put together. 2-person job. Screws and nuts are difficult to place. Instructions came with replacement instructions and screws. Screws strip easily. Instructions not very good. Took about 45 minutes for a simple project.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Carson

customer_reviews.title: Love this wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: Love this wheelbarrow. Easy to pull, fits through doors and high capacity for a wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: jhvcpa

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of predrilled holes ruin cart
customer_reviews.text: The four predrilled holes in main body were off center and would not let me use washers on the bolts when I assembled the cart. One set I could re-drill, but the other one had no room to fix the poor workmanship. I would not pay this much every again for subpar equipment.
customer_reviews.author: DAREN L EDEKER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for yard work. Gave away my old wheelbarrow, this is much better. Easy to assemble. Durable large wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Laveck

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: The best wheelbarrow/cart I have had. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lilo

customer_reviews.title: Tire Tubes are junk.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled and inflated the tires to 40 psi. Put it outside and a couple of hours later both tubes had split. It was hot outside but shouldn't happen. I don't have time to return it so I got different Tubes; hopefully better quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: RON DEKRAKER

customer_reviews.title: You "carried" yourself well
customer_reviews.text: Good design easy to assemble but I was working with heavier stones and loads then what it was made for
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: slightly difficult for one person to assemble.. clear instructions though.. Very sturdy cart
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Study, lightweight, great!
customer_reviews.text: Love my sturdy yet lightweight wheelbarrow. Best garden purchase I’ve made in ages.
customer_reviews.author: embrace-each-day!

customer_reviews.title: Both good things! Assembly was easy and the instructions were ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Overbuilt and over engineered! Both good things! Assembly was easy and the instructions were clear. I loaded this up over the brim with split wood to move as the first task. It lifted lightly and perfectly very well balanced. The big oversized tires make pushing easy and starting easy. For 115 bucks this is well worth the money and will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Great until it broke a week later.
customer_reviews.text: Great size and stability. However, wheel popped out of rim within a week of use. Would be wonderful to use if moving feathers or leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart for medium duty.
customer_reviews.text: The cart is well built for medium duty, it has ball bearing wheels and rubber tires. It rolls well and moves the load comfortably. It cost $35 more than the Simplay3 cart that I purchased with it and is 2 to 3 times better. The Simplay3 cart has plastic wheels with no bearings, the handle is attached with metal screws through the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Boer

customer_reviews.title: Good hauler
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, easy to put together, very happy with quality and ability to hall large loads.
customer_reviews.author: D M K

customer_reviews.title: Broke but manufacturer replaced for free
customer_reviews.text: Plastic bottom broke on second use but when I contacted the manufacturer for a warranty claim they sent a new one for free. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M Gerrish

customer_reviews.title: This is a real tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Combination of lightweight and very sturdy. Well made, a pleasure to use. Goes together very easy.
customer_reviews.author: S Day

customer_reviews.title: This Item was great and works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: This Item was great and works wonderfully. Just once concern please be careful when tightening the bolts. I had a bolt head snap off and had to go to my local hardware store and buy another one. other than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris V Lomeli Jr

customer_reviews.title: Th tub cracked and split from dumping material repeatedly Would not recommend or buy
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose but not constructed for the long haul. Th tub cracked and split from dumping material repeatedly Would not recommend or buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tony Q

customer_reviews.title: A+ product
customer_reviews.text: Best wheelbarrow I have ever owned. Do be aware you need to pump up the supplied tires! This is a quality Product!
customer_reviews.author: louie louie

customer_reviews.title: This was for my wife....
customer_reviews.text: And she loves it. Rolls easily, sturdy, and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Rugged & works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Pretty rugged and works well to move firewood from barn to house. Rolls well, seems well balanced. We'll see how it holds up over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Need Light

customer_reviews.title: Tire deflates after a few hours
customer_reviews.text: The tires provided by Polar Trailer are lousy. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Parts were tweaked
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, parts are not labeled well. The main bar is tweaked and won't for correctly
customer_reviews.author: Angelique Lamberson

customer_reviews.title: Worse assembly instruction ever.
customer_reviews.text: Out of everything we have ever had to put together these instructions have taken the cake for being the worse. They do not tell you which bolts and nuts go where. Had to figure it out on our own.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Balloon tires
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but strong, The balloon tiers sold me. Better than a wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.author: Dyon

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart
customer_reviews.text: I have hauled 5 cords of firewood in half the time and have saved my back. My neighbor borrowed it to lay down pavers. It is easy to maneuver, incredibly strong and very sturdy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not able to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to even get this item assembled. I can’t review the product because there is no way to put it together without bending medal. Please advise me if my options.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Denning

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product for any gardener
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with product. Needed some good tools (also, husband to put together) but that goes to the sturdiness and quality of the product. We both remarked that everything fit together so well!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! My mother loves it. Light, and wheels are huge.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Burn

customer_reviews.title: Wheel fell off after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Wheel fell off rim after a few uses. Would like to know how I could get a replacement since iam in the middle of a project with no wheel barrow
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and feels durable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and feels durable. Sort of bulky to store but it's the trade-off of a big barrow. Happy with the buy
customer_reviews.author: mrey

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed our expections!
customer_reviews.text: My husband couldn't be happier.....Me, too....no more tipping and it's nice and deep.
customer_reviews.author: BoxerMom

customer_reviews.title: This is the best wheelbarrow I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wheelbarrow I have owned! The two pneumatic tires go over anything. The handle is workable with either one or two hands, and one is often all that's necessary. Even my wife loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Popsicle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design Tires mobility and overall ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Howard karow

customer_reviews.title: Flat tire
customer_reviews.text: Trailer arrived with one flat tire, I put air in it and it slowly went flat overnight. Was unable to use.
customer_reviews.author: George P.Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Tires blew out! BOTH. Never over inflated. Inner tubes were dry rotted. Had to replace tube, break down tire, etc. very poor Quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately after moving 3 yards of dirt and easy usage the right popped off rim
customer_reviews.text: bought this for the capacity and double wheel design. Unfortunately after moving 3 yards of dirt and easy usage the right popped off rim, and we were babying this thing. Also the handle is about a foot too short, needs to be extended for that oh so necessary leverage.Luckily neighbor let us borrow his to finish job. would not recomend
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product but takes a while to build.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions aren't very clear as to which screws go where, but once its built its very solid. It sometimes feels very flimsy but I put about 250lbs in this thing and it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Damon McKernan

customer_reviews.title: Great For Older Adults
customer_reviews.text: Mt 75 year old mother loves this! It's easy for her to handle. Very stable and robust.
customer_reviews.author: Lowbasstone

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet but it looks like it well do the gardening job well
customer_reviews.author: mervat m.

customer_reviews.title: too small for ranch work
customer_reviews.text: too small. It was difficult to determine the size by the info in the ad. I like it I just wish I would have gotten the size up.
customer_reviews.author: dawn t hawks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent barrow
customer_reviews.text: Directions are a disaster. Written by an engineer I assume. Must rely on clairvoyance to assemble but the item is TERRIFIC!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: So far love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for horse barn, love it!!!!! Easy to push over bumps and way tub is low is weighted perfect for bad arthritis days. Could use a heavier wider handle
customer_reviews.author: kim smith

customer_reviews.title: As not easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Had to alter handle to be able to line up the attachment holes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The first week had to by new tier three new ties, Wheel Poor
customer_reviews.author: susan swanson

customer_reviews.title: Solid Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: Got here fast, works well in uneven/bumpy yard, easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Charles Allen

customer_reviews.title: Went together great, its sturdy and looks like it will last ...
customer_reviews.text: Went together great, its sturdy and looks like it will last a good long time. Only reason I withheld the 5th star, it would be nice if there was a small tool shelf as my wife likes to use it for her gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best trailer I have ever used! lightweight to handle, but heavy duty for work. Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer James

customer_reviews.title: A great well balanced cart!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use...not too heavy to lift...well built. Glad i found this one!
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: cub cart
customer_reviews.text: gave this to daughter for her to clean out her horse barn and she said she loves it, and it works great in the snow
customer_reviews.author: Anita Swanson

customer_reviews.title: This unit is wonderful and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: You need two people or long arms to insert and then tighten the bolts. This unit is wonderful and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Caillier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great garden cart, we are going to order another one!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little cart, sturdy and easy to assemble. It just barely fits between my interior doors allowing me to bring firewood from the porch to the wood stove.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Zumwinkel

product_meta.title: Polar Trailer #8449 Cub Cart, 50" x 28" x 29" Hauling Cart
product_meta.description: The Polar Cub Cart is the lightest, heavy-duty hand cart on the market. Perfect for any lawn duties on your checklist. It's 400-pound load capacity will handle everything from black dirt to landscaping rock to firewood. Features include an all-steel frame with powder coat finish, high impact polyethylene tub, rugged wide-track rubber tires and shielded ball bearings. Easy to assemble. Overall dimensions: 50" X 28" X 29". Body Dimensions: 37" x 27" x 16"
feature_bullets: Load capacity: 400 lbs, Load size: 7 cubic feet
Overall Dimensions: 50" X 28" X 29", Body Dimensions: 37" x 27" x 16"
Tire size: 15" x 4" x 8", Wide rugged wide-track rubber tires, Shielded ball bearings
